author: Nasiru Eneji Abdulrasheed
title: Alagoa Morris Inducted into the Niger Delta Environment Hall of Fame
text:
In a testament to unwavering commitment and passion for environmental advocacy in the Niger Delta, Alagoa Morris, Technical Adviser on Environment to the governor of Bayelsa State and Head of Programmes at Environmental Rights Friends of the Earth Nigeria, Yenagoa office, received distinguished honors in a ceremony that marked his induction into the Niger Delta Environment Hall of Fame.
The event, which took place at the Ijaw Nationality Hall of Fame located within the Ijaw House, Yenagoa, on February 16, 2024, not only celebrated Morris's relentless environmental endeavors but also emphasized the ongoing struggle for ecological justice in the Niger Delta.
The ceremony was a gathering of minds and spirits fervently dedicated to the cause of environmental preservation and sustainability. Alagoa Morris, alongside other notable figures such as a former Commissioner for Environment, Iniruo Wills, and Nengi James, the second Vice President of the Ijaw National Congress, were honored for their indelible contributions to environmental advocacy.
The Chief Historian and Archivist of the Bayelsa State government, Prof Stephen Olali, who performed the ceremony, underscored the significance of recognizing such efforts in a region long plagued by environmental degradation and exploitation.
The induction into the Niger Delta Environment Hall of Fame and the conferment of membership in the Forum of Visiting Public Intellectuals of the Bayelsa State History and Archives Office serve as a testament to Morris’s dedication. This recognition shines a light on his and his peers' tireless work towards not only advocating for environmental rights but also educating and mobilizing the community towards sustainable environmental practices.
A Portrait of Dedication
The unveiling of Alagoa Morris's portrait at the Ijaw Nationality Hall of Fame stands as a symbolic gesture of permanence, a forever reminder of the impact one individual's passion and perseverance can have on the collective consciousness of a community. This accolade, while personal, transcends the individual, reflecting a broader narrative of resilience and hope in the face of environmental challenges that beset the Niger Delta region.
Such honors highlight the critical role of environmental advocacy in shaping policies and practices that safeguard the region's ecological integrity for future generations. Through education, activism, and direct engagement with both the community and policymakers, advocates like Morris are at the forefront of a movement striving for a harmonious coexistence between human development and environmental preservation.

title: AMLO reivindica defensa de la soberanía a 162 años de Batalla de Puebla
text:
El presidente Andrés Manuel López Obrador reivindicó este domingo la defensa de la soberanía nacional, al conmemorar el 162 aniversario de la Batalla de Puebla, donde rechazó que México quiera ser colonia o protectorado de otra nación o potencia económica global.
“México es una nación libre, independiente y soberana. No somos ni queremos ser nunca una colonia o un protectorado de ningún Gobierno extranjero, trátese de Rusia, de China, de Francia o de Estados Unidos”, afirmó antes de dar inicio al desfile cívico militar en la ciudad de Puebla, en el centro del país.
El mandatario aseguró que la condición fundamental de México es ser un país libre e independiente frente jóvenes que concluyeron su servicio militar en el acto protocolario, mismos a los que tomó protesta junto a autoridades de las Fuerzas Armadas.
Aseguró que México está abierto a la integración económica, a la cooperación multilateral, así como una relación de respeto entre países y una política de buena vecindad, además de estar a favor de la amistad entre los pueblos.
El presidente López Obrador recordó que este 5 de mayo se conmemoran 162 años de la ‘Batalla de Puebla’, un momento histórico en el que mexicanos expulsaron a tropas de Francia en 1862, en medio de la segunda intervención francesa.
Sin embargo, mencionó que tampoco fue la única batalla que tuvo que enfrentar el país frente a intentos de naciones extranjeras por hacer de México una colonia de nuevo.
Por ello, afirmó que México “se ganó, con el sacrificio, con el sufrimiento, con la sangre derramada de hombres y mujeres, su derecho a ser un país independiente y soberano”.
Te puede interesar
“El mejor homenaje que podemos rendir a quienes hace 162 años defendieron a la patria de la agresión y voracidad extranjera, es invocar su memoria para decirles que las y los mexicanos de esta generación hemos recuperado la soberanía, la dignidad nacional y la libertad para decidir el rumbo de México”, sostuvo.
El mandatario dijo que México decide su política interna sin injerencias ni presiones extranjeras, así como que ha establecido “relaciones constructivas, pacíficas, respetuosas y en pie de igualdad con otros pueblos del mundo”.
“Hemos dejado atrás una época de entreguismo y sumisión. Estamos empeñados en construir un México verdaderamente democrático y en combatir la corrupción, la desigualdad y la pobreza; y que la semilla del ejemplo de los que lucharon en la Batalla de Puebla ha caído en tierra fértil”, abundó.
El mandatario mexicano llegó al colegio militar de la central ciudad de Puebla, acompañado de los titulares de las Fuerzas Armadas, secretario de la Defensa Nacional, Luis Cresencio Sandoval, y de la Secretaría de Marina, José Rafel Ojeda Durán.
En el acto protocolario también estuvieron presentes los titulares de las secretarías de Gobernación, Luisa María Alcalde, de Seguridad y Protección Ciudadana, Rosa Icela Rodríguez, entre otras personalidades del gabinete mexicano, además del gobernador del estado de Puebla, Sergio Salomón.
EFE

author: Web Developer
title: Mumbai weather updates: Temperature rises with AQI at 124; check temperature, air quality here
text:
13 December,2024 10:07 AM IST | Mumbai | [ mid-day online correspondent ](https://www.mid-day.com/author-detail/mid-day-online-correspondent-67)
Representational Image
After experiencing a significant drop in temperatures, Mumbai is now seeing a slight rise. Over the past couple of days, the city has witnessed sharp fluctuations in temperature.
According to the latest Mumbai weather updates from the [Indian Meteorological Department](https://www.mid-day.com/mumbai/mumbai-news/article/decoding-mumbais-weather-the-science-the-imds-fight-for-accurate-weather-predictions-in-mumbai-an-in-depth-analysis-of-the-challenges-and-why-they-persiste-behind-forecasting-and-its-complex-challenges-23375728) (IMD), Mumbai is expected to experience a cloudy sky on Friday, December 13, with temperatures ranging from a cool 17 degrees Celsius in the morning to a warm 36 degrees Celsius during the day.
According to the [Mumbai weather updates](https://www.mid-day.com/mumbai/mumbai-news/article/woman-allegedly-kills-1-year-old-son-after-dispute-with-mother-in-law-in-thane-23445349) of the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD), Mumbai's Santacruz observatory in suburban Mumbai recorded a maximum temperature of 32.8 degrees Celsius and a minimum temperature of 19.3 degrees Celsius.
The weather department's data showed that the city observatory in Colaba recorded a maximum temperature of 31.3 degrees Celcius and the minimum temperature was recorded at 21.5 degrees Celsius.

According to the latest Mumbai weather updates by the IMD, the maximum temperature will likely be around 36 degrees Celsius, and the minimum temperature will likely be around 17 degrees Celsius. The relative humidity is 42 per cent. The sun rose at 07:03 AM and will set at 6:03 PM.
On December 12, the Central Pollution Control Board's SAMEER app reported in its latest Mumbai weather updates that the [city's air quality](https://www.mid-day.com/mumbai/mumbai-news/article/air-pollution-in-mumbai-mpcb-implements-stricter-guidelines-for-rmc-plants-in-mumbai-to-combat-air-pollution-23439728) remained in the 'moderate' category, with an Air Quality Index (AQI) of 124 at 9:05 AM.
As per the SAMEER app dashboard, many areas across Mumbai showed 'moderate' AQI. Bandra Kurla Complex recorded 'moderate' air quality with an AQI of 153. Ghatkopar, Kandivali, Kurla and Worli recorded 'moderate' air quality with an AQI of 109, 129, 101 and 118, respectively.
Borivali recorded 'good' air quality, with an AQI of 93.
According to data from the SAMEER app, Navi Mumbai recorded air quality in the 'moderate' category with an AQI of 126, while Thane registered a 'good' AQI of 87.
The air quality index from 0 to 100 is considered 'good', 100 to 200 'moderate', 200 to 300 'poor', 300 to 400 'very poor' and from 400 to 500 or above 'severe'.
Meanwhile, as air pollution levels continue to rise in Mumbai, the [Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation ](https://www.mid-day.com/mumbai/mumbai-news/article/mumbai-aqi-bmc-chief-calls-for-joint-effort-to-improve-city-mmrs-air-quality-23408502)(BMC) has revised guidelines issued last year for construction sites. The civic body will also form squads at the ward level to visit construction sites and act if guidelines are flouted. Sensor-based air pollution monitoring systems will be installed at all construction project work sites and immediate action to be taken if pollution levels are detected above the limit.
